column4: I dont understand how automatix can disappear out of no where
just when I was getting ubuntu setup
Automatix is a great way to break your system
download the .deb from the website, and install it by doubleclicking on it
I have no idea.  google says it's at getswiftfox.com
but, it appears to be down at the moment
See that on instruction.  You should've said this at the beginning.  You're looking for a whole different set of answers.
yes.  And you would for swiftfox too.
actually, you can't for swiftfox.  Because the deb would be 32bit.
What are you talking about?  There's a binary driver released for 64bit only?  Which one?
64bit and 32bit ubuntu are virtually identical.  Except in 64bit you can't use the binary-only drivers 32bit has
no.  Don't use sudo su.  If you want a root shell, sudo -i
./linux-installer.sh  (the current directory isn't in the path)
or you might have to do `bash linux-installer.sh`
